availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh M. Stitt (Nicholas County, Kentucky, hotel keeper and post master)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, hotel keeper and post master. Kentucky native. Married to Cinderella Fisher Stitt in Nicholas County, Kentucky on October 21, 1858. Father of Lizzie Lee Stitt. Laborer in Nicholas County in 1850. Postmaster in Carlisle in 1860. Co-owner of Nicholas House tavern in Nicholas County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas, District 2, p. 405B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Town of Carlisle, District 1, p. 5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas, Carlisle, p. 277A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film #000252410.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Nicholas County, KY, May 1863, p. 13, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
